instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.SMC_TPAD_RST_L: What is SMC_TPAD_RST_L? SMC_TPAD_RST_L is a signal that comes from the trackpad that can reset the SMC when it is low.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v. The trackpad having corrosion from liquid damage is a very common cause of no light on the magsafe charger & the system not turning on, when the trackpad or trackpad cable is corroded and holding this line down. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard
threads.message: there is power on all pins except 1 2 and 3 and that lead me to <CHIP>U4850</CHIP> and when i measured the pins on <CHIP>U4850</CHIP> i get voltage on pin 4 10 and 6    ---   so on pin 4 i have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>, and pin 10 is <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> and pin 6 is <SIGNAL>SMC_TPAD_RST_L</SIGNAL> and the rest of the pins 0 volts. Any ideas ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard
threads.message: First try a known good trackpad cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard
threads.message: The trackpad is working. The only thing ive noticed on the power pads im getting 2.4v and i have another working computer same model and on that one im gettin 3.4v. So my problem is <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> but where this signal comes from ???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard
threads.message: I've replaced <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> and now i have 3.4v on pin 5 on the keyboard but when i short the power pads computer doesn't shut off

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard
threads.message: What makes you think a working trackpad proves that the trackpad cable is ok. Just look at diagram how this all works. <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> is just the power button and has nothing to do with the rest of the keyboard. First get the keyboard to work then look at why power button is not working.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard
threads.message: I'm confused now. I haven't work on retinas a lot. Do i need the trackpad cable plugged in in order for the keyboard to work ? And i cant also understand why i can't start or shut off the board thru the power pads. Do i have problems with the SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard
threads.message: Give me a hint man where is the connection between the Trackpad cable and keyboard there is no board view on this model it so hard to work on this board im using similar board view. I've had Bios issues on this board i've solve that i had LCD issue i fix that too after had SSd issue i fix that too this board drives me crazy. :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard
threads.message:
You already did lots of things to this board. I need to know what they were. You cannot just swap BIOSes on these. 

<CHIP>U4820</CHIP>/30 are keyboard controllers and are on i2c bus to trackpad so keyboard issue can be trackpad or cable/connector too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard
threads.message: i didn't swap Bios i fix the via's around the bios. Thanks for the hint ill check it now

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard
threads.message: i can't find <CHIP>U4820</CHIP> and <CHIP>U4830</CHIP> on board view because u use similar board view, Any suggestions please ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard
threads.message: Here strange thing I've noticed i started to measuring voltage on the trackpad connector and since all the board views i have all trackpad connectors have 22 pins bit this has 44 so it helped me just with the orientation of the connector so the pins closest to the edge of the board taking number one from the SPI side are 1  3  5  7  9  11  and  13, all of this pins are shorted to ground and the other side pins 2  4  6  8  10  12  14 they all have 13volts on them, and according to the schematics the pins 2  6  and 14 should be ground. Any ideas ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard
threads.message: You have not tried a known good trackpad and cable. Without eliminating that there is no use in any further trouble shooting.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard
threads.message: i will order cable do you think i'll need to try different trackpad too ?
